summary: Environmental scientist with an MBA and a BS in Biology, experienced in environmental research and development, and eight years running a home-based Personal Chef business. Skilled in marketing, business development, client relationships, budgeting, negotiations, and project management.

experience.title: Owner, Personal Chef
experience.description: Established marketing and sales strategies including Gourmet-to-Go counter at local supermarket; acquired 20 new clients within first year; managed entire selling cycle from needs assessment to pricing and closing; planned, coordinated and executed events for up to 125 guests; recognized with Freshwater Flavors Award; Business by Referral Team Facilitator for Blue Water Chamber of Commerce.

experience.title: Environmental Scientist
experience.description: Performed Phase I and II Environmental Site Assessments, NEPA Reviews, and Real Estate Transaction Screens; interpreted analytical results and developed corrective actions; conducted Hazardous Materials Surveys including asbestos, lead-based paint, and mold investigations; performed industrial hygiene sampling and indoor air quality investigations; conducted on-site field quality controls including soil and groundwater monitoring; maintained client accounts and project management; liaison with Verizon and Sprint regarding environmental statutes, regulations, training and applications.

experience.title: Product Development Technician
experience.description: Performed ASTM testing methods and ISO standards for product development phases including standard and end-use performance testing; performed quality control functions including testing and development of laboratory work instructions; collaborated with Environmental Health and Safety Coordinator to address safety; updated Chemical Hygiene Plan for R&D.

experience.title: Optometric Technician
experience.description: Managed daily operations of a small optometric physician's office; scheduling, filing, supply ordering, inventory control and customer service; obtained patient vital signs and performed initial diagnostic testing prior to Optometrist exam.

experience.title: Telemetry Technician
experience.description: Performed Cardiac Telemetry monitoring; assisted nurses with obtainment of vital signs and basic patient care.

certifications: OSHA 29 CFR 191.120 40-hour Hazardous Waste Training and subsequent 8-hour refresher courses (2002-2006)
